clinical_study.brief_title: Transvaginal Natural Orifice Endoscopic Surgery for Extremely Obese Patients With Early-stage Endometrial Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Transvaginal Natural Orifice Endoscopic Surgery (v-NOTES) for Extremely Obese Patients With Early-stage Endometrial Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Dr. Lutfi Kirdar Kartal Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Dr. Lutfi Kirdar Kartal Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the feasibility and efficacy of the v-NOTES approach for extremely obese patients with early-stage type 1 endometrial cancer.

primary_outcome.description: The operation time in minutes. The operation time was from commencement of the colpotomy incision to vaginal closure.

primary_outcome.measure: Any conversion to conventional laparoscopy or laparotomy
primary_outcome.description: Number of the patients whose surgery couldn't completed by transvaginal natural orifice surgery.
Hemoglobin levels in g/dL. Hemoglobin levels of the patients before surgery and on postoperative day 1.
Length of hospital stay in days. Duration of hospital stay was calculated from the patient's admission until hospital discharge.
Number of the patients who have any complication during or after transvaginal natural orifice surgery.

Pain scores in VAS score. Pain scores were evaluated using a visual analog scale (VAS). Scores are based on self-reported measures of pain that are recorded with a single handwritten mark placed at one point along the length of a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between the two ends of the scale—"no pain" on the left end (0 cm) of the scale and the "worst pain" on the right end of the scale (10 cm).

Pain scores in VAS score. Pain scores were evaluated using a visual analog scale (VAS). Scores are based on self-reported measures of pain that are recorded with a single handwritten mark placed at one point along the length of a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between the two ends of the scale—"no pain" on the left end (0 cm) of the scale and the "worst pain" on the right end of the scale (10 cm).

Pain scores in VAS score. Pain scores were evaluated using a visual analog scale (VAS). Scores are based on self-reported measures of pain that are recorded with a single handwritten mark placed at one point along the length of a 10-cm line that represents a continuum between the two ends of the scale—"no pain" on the left end (0 cm) of the scale and the "worst pain" on the right end of the scale (10 cm).

arm_group.arm_group_label: extremely obese patients with early-stage endometrial cancer

intervention.intervention_name: Transvaginal natural orifice endoscopic surgery for endometrial cancer staging
intervention.description: Cases of extreme obese patients with early stage endometrial cancer who underwent v-NOTES
intervention.arm_group_label: extremely obese patients with early-stage endometrial cancer

study_pop.textblock: Extreme obese patients with early stage type-1 endometrial cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Extreme obese patients
- Early stage type-1 endometrial cancer proved by endometrial sampling
Exclusion Criteria:
- any contraindication for pneumoperitoneum
- any contraindication for the dorsal lithotomy position
- any contraindication for general anesthesia,
- any contraindication for v-NOTES
- suspicion of pelvic adhesions
- presence or suspicion of obliteration of the pouch of Douglas
